ngiemboon: Shÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie à júʼu shwóŋò Ssé, ńgÿo páʼ á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Blessed are those who hear the word of God and do it.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ giŋe shÿò paʼá páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie menkÿo kwò ɔ̀ la.
en: You walk improperly as if you have a rope on your feet.
Don't call this gentleman, he's a loving man.
Don't call this gentleman, he's a loving man.

ngiemboon: Mbab mêmvfó gẅiin shÿòonte ńcʉa ye ngáb.
en: Goat meat has more protein than chicken meat.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɔ̌b tà ngie shÿɔ̂málà mbwo mefág.
en: They sang until they said “shÿɔ̂málà” to the twins.
those there (distant demonstrative pronoun referring to class 5 and 8 nouns)
those ... there (distant demonstrative adjective referring to class 5 and 8 nouns)

ngiemboon: Lelÿɔʼ sɔɔn á lekʉŋ, gʉa ḿbí si pɔ́gɔ̀ kẅiʼi mǒ.
en: Here is the yam in the pot, go take that we add on top.

ngiemboon: A ka zɔ́ʼɔ nzwě we tà ńgÿo sí.
en: He married his wife until he went to the ball.
yours (second person plural possessive pronoun referring back to class 5 and 8 nouns)
your (second person plural possessive adjective modifying class 5 and 8 nouns)
your (second person plural emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 5 and 8 nouns)
who (relative pronoun modifying class 5 and 8 nouns)

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ʼ lesoŋ sie é ne ńgyáŋa!
Asìɛ fúɔ tǒ tà ńnéŋe ssé.
en: The lice searcher came over and sat down.

ngiemboon: Asìɛ fúɔ tǒ tà ńnéŋe ssé.
en: The lice searcher came over and sat down.

ngiemboon: Múɔ wɔɔn láʼ gwɔ kwàʼ sìle mmó.
en: This child will be a real economist.
